candidates.title: Introduce forking
candidates.body:
## Usage related changes

- Close #195
- User instructions are in `README.md` under `Forking`
  - basically it's a subset of [Devnet-py's](https://0xspaceshard.github.io/starknet-devnet/docs/guide/fork/) CLI params, but the origin interaciton possibilities should be the same (if not better)
- In case of `NoStateAtBlock`, a wildcard error is returned instead of `ContractError`

## Development related changes

- Add two forking structures: `OriginForwarder` and `StarknetDefaulter` (read more about them in the code docs)
- Use 6 parallel jobs in testing (previously had 7 - failing)
  - Related: #378
  - If #391 is merged before this PR, the conflict shall be resolved in favor of that PR
- Improve testing by adding utilities
  - e.g. `BackgroundDevnet` methods like `create_block`, `fork`, `get_balance_at_block`
- Two e2e tests interact with Sepolia.
- Replace `StateHistoryDisabled` error with `NoStateAtBlock`
- Add `get_block_number` method to `timestamp.cairo` testing contract and rename it to `block_reader.cairo`
- Refactor `crates/starknet-devnet-server/src/api/json_rpc/mod.rs` to call `.to_rpc_result()` in only one place.

## Checklist:

- [x] Applied formatting - `./scripts/format.sh`
- [x] No linter errors - `./scripts/clippy_check.sh`
- [x] No unused dependencies - `./scripts/check_unused_deps.sh`
- [x] Performed code self-review
- [x] Rebased to the last commit of the target branch (or merged it into my branch)
- [x] Documented the changes
- [x] Linked the issues which this PR resolves
- [x] Checked the TODO section in README.md if this PR resolves it
- [x] Updated the tests
- [x] All tests are passing - `cargo test`

candidates.title: rpc 0.7.0
candidates.body:
## Usage related changes

RPC 0.7.0
Starknet 0.13.1

## Development related changes

- `CasmContractClass` is moved from `cairo_lang_starknet` to `cairo_lang_starknet_classes`.
- Added nonzero_ext lib to work with NonZero types.
- Changed cli param `gas_price` to `NonZeroU128` from `u64`, so conversions can be avoided.
- Changed tests setup to reflect for the increase in gas fee for transactions, mostly Declare txns. (expected behavior https://spaceshard.slack.com/archives/C03HL8DH52N/p1708538169996519?thread_ts=1708496338.100619&cid=C03HL8DH52N)
- And decrease in gas fee for the other types of txns
- Refactored `estimate_transaction_fee` to use blockifier helper functions
- Added `MAX_BYTECODE_SIZE_LIMIT` constant which  is needed for converting from Sierra to Cash (https://spaceshard.slack.com/archives/C05FAMWQ8JE/p1708269433783959)
- Added `execution_resources` to traces
- Updated blockifier to 0.5.0-rc.3
- Added `get_versioned_constants` method that replaces constants regarding VMResources, such as builtins and steps, using default blockifier values.
- Changed `get_transaction_receipt_by_hash` signature, to avoid copying of the input param.
- Added `get_block_with_receipts`.
- Edited `starknet_traceBlockTransactions` to return Vec<BlockTransactionTrace> instead of an object, because it adds additional traces property to the serialized object.
- Added data_gas props to BlockHeader
- Excluded `starknet_getBlockWithReceipts` from testing the json request/response, because we use the transaction object in the response which contains the transaction hash, but in the RPC spec this property is omitted. Also the spec is not released yet and its format maybe can change. Also requires refactoring to exclude the transaction_hash from already saved Transactions #363 
- Removed usage of starknet_rs FeeEstimate, because its missing some fields from the new spec.
- Refactored ExecutionResources -> ComputationResources + DataAvailability.
- Added custom deserialisation to DataAvailability because it fails to deserialize to u128, due to limitation in serde, when used in combination with #[flatten]
- Updated circleci image to use 1.71.0
- Change execution_resources of traces to be of type ComputationResources
- Edited integration tests, because the fee is part of transaction_hash calculation.
- renamed update_block_context to advance_block_context_block_number
- Ignored execution of estimate_fee_tests because starknet-rs doesn't support 0.7.0 rpc.
- Edited integration tests of simulate_transactions


## Checklist:

- [x] Applied formatting - `./scripts/format.sh`
- [x] No linter errors - `./scripts/clippy_check.sh`
- [ ] No unused dependencies - `./scripts/check_unused_deps.sh`
- [x] Performed code self-review
- [x] Rebased to the last commit of the target branch (or merged it into my branch)
- [x] Documented the changes
- [x] Linked the issues which this PR resolves
- [x] Checked the TODO section in README.md if this PR resolves it
- [x] Updated the tests
- [x] All tests are passing - `cargo test`

candidates.title: Publish as crate
candidates.body:
## Usage related changes

<!-- How the changes from this PR affect users. -->

## Development related changes

Metadata changes
Added `cairo-lang-...` dependencies due to dependency resolution problem, because a breaking change was introduced in a minor version and when publishing a crate, the cargo.lock file can't be used and the dependencies resolution starts from scratch.
Added script for checking if last version of a crate is different from the current one.
Renamed `starknet-devnet-cli` to `starknet-devnet`
Edited README.md
Changed CircleCI workflow, by adding additional step to a job and changed the name of the job. Also changed the machine which was used for running the workflow

candidates.title: Make server side public for 3d-party reuse.
candidates.body:
## Usage related changes

<!-- How the changes from this PR affect users. -->
Now developers can utilize devnet's server logic for spawning server instance from their codebase, interact directly with handlers .  This change shalln't break any existing projects base on devnet.

IMO better modularity of the project. Now `starknet-server` crate is more of `starknet-cli`(devnet-cli) that utilizes `server` library. Anyone can create whatever based on `server` lib now.

This closes #305 with 1st approach.

## Development related changes
<!-- How these changes affect the developers of this project. E.g. changes in dev tools, testing, CI/CD... -->
Server side is now maintained in `server` crate.

candidates.title: 0.6 spec
candidates.body:
## Usage related changes

0.6.0 RPC spec

## Development related changes

- added `not` property to spec reader
- refactored `BroadcastedInvokeTransaction`, `BroadcastedDeployAccountTransaction` to be enum with variants
- updated starknet-rs
- added method `into_vec` for converting vector of elements to vector of another elements, when From trait is implemented
- added test utility methods for V3 transactions
- added V3 transactions and unit tests for them
- use spec 0.6.0-rc5
- added contract address(https://testnet.starkscan.co/contract/0x04718f5a0fc34cc1af16a1cdee98ffb20c31f5cd61d6ab07201858f4287c938d) for starknet token similar to ETH. Predeployed accounts initial balance is changed for ETH and STRK
- renamed ERC20_CONTRACT_ADDRESS to ETH_ERC20_CONTRACT_ADDRESS
- refactored `Accounted` trait -> `get_balance` to return the balance in the ETH or STRK
- made chargeable account owner of ETH and STRK contracts 
- added custom serialization for `ResourceBoundsMapping`, because according to the spec `l1_gas` and `l2_gas` are lowercase keys, but in the `ResourceBoundsMapping` map the keys are uppercase
- added `simulation_flags` input parameter to `estimate_fee`
- marked multiple integration tests with `[ignore]` attribute, because current starknet-rs version doesnt support `simulation_flags` for `estimate_fee` - https://github.com/0xSpaceShard/starknet-devnet-rs/issues/274
- edited message on devnet startup, to show that the initial balance is in WEI and STRK
- updated README.md
- created an issue about integration tests https://github.com/0xSpaceShard/starknet-devnet-rs/issues/275
- [changed resource price field name from price_in_strk to price_in_fri](https://github.com/0xSpaceShard/starknet-devnet-rs/pull/273/commits/92af53e73812c43bc6ee86db7595a0c907342486)
- [changed execution resources type from Felt to usize](https://github.com/0xSpaceShard/starknet-devnet-rs/pull/273/commits/67e7ed91259f79757e5105f69c918ea04025fcc1)
- [refactored common transaction receipt by removing transaction output](https://github.com/0xSpaceShard/starknet-devnet-rs/pull/273/commits/00a2c61b1bcee4a21aed2eb586fcbc4cefea6b6a)
- [receipt returns actual fee as object](https://github.com/0xSpaceShard/starknet-devnet-rs/pull/273/commits/25373ca90f50884aed6e5dfb6e3eaf376ad7948f)
- [set default value to price_in_fri](https://github.com/0xSpaceShard/starknet-devnet-rs/pull/273/commits/35b487816c36b836fd80248664ab5f9ac5c942ad)


## Checklist:

candidates.title: Update to Starknet 0.13.0
candidates.body:
## Usage related changes

- Update to Starknet 0.13.0

## Development related changes

- Related to updating to JSON-RPC v0.6.0
- Update blockifier to v0.4.0-rc8 (and related dependencies as well)
- One TODO left in the code - the new tx fee errors are complicated so I'm unsure about the extensiveness of the matching
  - if no objections, I'll just remove the TODO and the commented line(s)
- Rename our custom `FeeError` to `MaxFeeZeroError`
  - I thought it would be necessary to introduce a new Fee related error so I thought this renaming was necessary, but it turned out all the tests are passing without the new error; still, I think it's better with this change
- Some tests were failing because now invalid nonce is reported before insufficient balance, so I had to modify the declaration body; these are the tests, both in `get_transaction_receipt_by_hash_integration_tests`:
  - `declare_v1_accepted_with_numeric_entrypoint_offset`
  - `declare_v1_transaction_fails_with_insufficient_max_fee`

candidates.title: Testing improvements
candidates.body:
## Usage related changes

None

## Development related changes
Introduces some refactoring to improve the overall testing experience

- Closes #243
- Renames `devnet.rs` to `background_devnet.rs`
  - This has been bugging me for some time - having a file called devnet.rs inside the devnet repository is just wrong.
- Introduces `UniqueAutoDeletableFile`
  - Closes #205
  - Unlike [NamedTempFile](https://docs.rs/tempfile/latest/tempfile/struct.NamedTempFile.html), it doesn't create the file on struct construction, so it is more suitable for our use case.
  - Useful in dumping/loading tests.
  - Prevents name collisions - we no longer have to come up with unique dump artifact names.
  - Automatically deletes the underlying file when the variable is dropped - no need to remember to delete.

## Checklist:

- [x] Applied formatting - `./scripts/format.sh`
- [x] No linter errors - `./scripts/clippy_check.sh`

candidates.title: Update starknet-rs to fix offset serde
candidates.body:
## Usage related changes

- After https://github.com/xJonathanLEI/starknet-rs/pull/491 has been merged, we can rely on starknet-rs to accept Declaration V1 transactions that have numeric entrypoint offset.
  - Closes #179 

## Development related changes

- Updates starknet-rs crates to latest versions
  - In `test_simulate_transactions.rs` this required introducing a new necessary boolean argument to some functions.

candidates.title: 0.5.0 spec
candidates.body:
## Changes

### Test module `spec_reader`
For generating JSON requests and responses from JSON-RPC specification. 
edit_spec_instructions.yaml file is used for correcting some errors in the spec and removing some PENDING structs, because we dont support pending feature yet
NOTE: If for some reason there are unwraps in this module, keep in mind that its only used in tests.
NOTE: the specs in test_data are not 100% similar to the the spec in starkware repo, due to limitation of modifying the spec some irrelevant data to devnet was removed manually

- `ApiError::ContractError` receives an `Error` as parameter. Serializing `ContractError` to `RpcResult` populates the data object.
- Added .cargo/config.toml with entries - `RPC_SPEC_VERSION`, `STARKNET_VERSION`
- Removed `starknet_pendingTransactions`
- Added `starknet_specVersion`
- Removed method `StarknetTransaction::create_rejected`
- Made StarknetTransaction::finality_status member field non-optional
- Added `starknet_getTransactionStatus` RPC method
- Added `starknet_version` and `l1_gas_price`
- Added `execution_resources` to receipt
- Decorate most of the input/output structs with `deny_unknown_fields`, so we can be maximally compliant with the specification.
- Removed `PatriciaKeyHex` and moved its serialization/deserialization to `Starknet-types`
- Removed data.rs file
- Adapted `test_simulate_transactions.rs`
- Extracted resource fee costs names into `constants.rs`
- Added conversion from `StateDiff` to `ThinStateDiff`
- Refactor `StateUpdate` to hold `StateDiff`, instead of its flattened properties
- Added some TODOs which should be handled by this issue: #248 
- Added Deserialize or Serialize to some structs in so they can be tested with the spec_reader.
- All endpoints read/write now return StarknetResponse enum, which has an entry for every method. It is used for being able to match if generated response from spec_generator can be deserialised to the implemented one.
- Refactor `api_error_to_rpc_error` 
- Wrap write_endpoints.rs methods input params into enums in the form `BroadcastedDeclareTransactionEnumWrapper` for specifying the type, because before only accepting BroadcastedDeclareTransaction doesn't accept a type field, but in the spec a type field is specified for all input objects for the methods `addDeclareTransaction`, `addInvokeTransaction`, `addDeployAccountTransaction`
- Implemented logic for calculating `ExecutionResources` in transaction receipt
- Remove abi field when deserializing to Sierra contract class, If the field is empty. 
- Removed some irrelevant for 0.5.0 test_data files - declare_accepted.json and invoke_accepted.json
- Refactored `message_available_if_estimation_panics` to send custom rpc request, instead of using starknet-rs, because with 0.5.0 the data field of the error result is populated with information and in this test we need to check the revert reason returned from the rpc request

## Checklist:

- [ ] Created git tag `json-rpc-0.4.0` on `main` just before this PR is merged
- [x] Applied formatting - `./scripts/format.sh`
- [x] No linter errors - `./scripts/clippy_check.sh`
- [ ] Performed code self-review
- [x] Rebased to the last commit of the target branch (or merged it into my branch)
- [x] Documented the changes
- [x] Linked the issues which this PR resolves
- [x] Checked the TODO section in README.md if this PR resolves it
- [x] Updated the tests
- [x] All tests are passing - `cargo test`

candidates.title: Remove starknet_in_rust
candidates.body:
Closing #18 , #146 , #222 

## Development related changes

- Replaced imports of `starknet_in_rust` classes with `cairo_lang_starknet`. `starknet_in_rust` just reexported them.
- Remove usage of `starknet_in_rust` helper methods.
- Replaced with logic from `starknet_rs` for transactions hash computation
- `compute_casm_class_hash` logic copied from `starknet_in_rust`
- `compute_sierra_class_hash` - used `starknet`-rs implementation

## Note:
 tests using starknet_in_rust are temporary, only for checking if the copied logic have the same behavior as the original one. In one of the next PRs, when blockifier is updated, starknet_in_rust will be removed and the tests relying on it.

## Checklist:

candidates.title: Improve CLI exiting; refactor config
candidates.body:
## Usage related changes

- Improve the look of CLI error messages (rely on clap instead of panic)
- Closes #34

## Development related changes

- Move StarknetConfig to separate file
- Derive `clap::ValueEnum` for:
  - `DumpOn` (renamed from `DumpMode` for parsing simplicity)
  - `ChainId` (renamed enum options to have lowercase n: `MainNet` -> `Mainnet`
    - I thought this would allow for simpler parsing, but turned out I had to use `clap(name = ...)` regardless
- Remove `strum` dependencies (replaced by functionality present in `clap`)
- Removed the option to select Testnet2 chain ID ([Starknet already deprecated it](https://spaceshard.slack.com/archives/C05FAMWQ8JE/p1694439538234259))

## Checklist:

- [x] Applied formatting - `./scripts/format.sh`
- [x] No linter errors - `./scripts/clippy_check.sh`
